metadata.Title: CVE-2023-32207 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
A missing delay in popup notifications could have made it possible for anattacker to trick a user into granting permissions. This vulnerabilityaffects Firefox < 113, Firefox ESR < 102.11, and Thunderbird < 102.11.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-32207` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:102.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.11.0+build1-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
mozjs78 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs91 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
